official_title: A bill to amend the Federal Trade Commission Act to authorize appropriations for the Federal Trade Commission.
short_title: Federal Trade Commission Reauthorization Act of 2000

summary.text: Federal Trade Commission Reauthorization Act of 2000 - Amends the Federal Trade Commission Act to authorize appropriations for the Federal Trade Commission for FY 2001 and 2002.Directs the Attorney General and the Federal Trade Commission (FTC) each to designate for hearing certain information and documentary request petitions a senior official not directly involved in the antitrust enforcement recommendation review process concerning the proposed merger or acquisition at issue. Requires such officials to hear any petition filed with the FTC, by the acquiring person or by the person whose voting securities or assets are to be acquired, to determine: (1) whether a request for additional information or documentary material is unreasonably cumulative, unduly burdensome or duplicative; or (2) whether the request for such information or material has been substantially complied with by the petitioning person. Provides for an expedited merger review process of petitions filed with the FTC. Directs the Attorney General and the FTC to report annually to Congress with respect to merger notifications and the submission of additional information or documentary material relevant to such mergers.
